page.title: 10Farming, Buxton.
page.content: The town of Buxton lies in the valley of the River Wye; the farmland surrounding the town is only suitable as pastureland between the edges of the town and the start of the heather moorlands of the Peak District. There are only three working farms left in Fairfield. Three other farms are not working now. The land is sold or rented. Staden Farm and Slade Hill Farm to the S.E. of the town are both dairy farms. Nithen End Farm and Cold Springs Farm on the Long Hill road both stock cattle and sheep, but Cold Springs Farm is also one of Buxton's main camping sites. There are also a number of allotments, but the climate is not particularly kind towards vegetable growers and the plots in the Fairfield area are largely overgrown.
